quotes.quote: Chaos in nature is immediately challenging and forces a good artist to impose some type of order on his or her perception of a site.

Every chaos has an order hidden in it. What we see as a chaos, is actually driven by a very disciplined and dedicated order of things. What we need to do is focus on the stuff before us, make our way through this chaos, and that order will sort itself out for us.
Chaos in the world brings uneasiness, but it also allows the opportunity for creativity and growth.
The more chaos there is, the more science holds on to abstract systems of control, and the more chaos is engendered.

Chaos magic is the idea that a particular set of beliefs serves as an active force in the world. In other words, we choose what and how we believe, and our beliefs are tools that we then use to make things happen or not.
Chaos is inherent in all compounded things. Strive on with diligence.
Chaos at the bottom means order at the top. Order at the bottom means chaos at the top.
Chaos is peaceful when you stand quietly & watch we are eternal observers, reflecting both tiny & vast, singing infinitely within.

Chaos is what we've lost touch with. This is why it is given a bad name. It is feared by the dominant archetype of our world, which is Ego, which clenches because its existence is defined in terms of control.
Chaos is not the lack of order, it is merely the absence of order, that the observer is used to.
Chaos claims the unwary or the incomplete. A true man may flinch away its embrace, if he is stalwart, and he girds his soul with the armour of contempt.
Chaos is the only thing that honestly wants you to grow. The only friend who really helps you be creative.
Chaos half-loosed cannot be long controlled; it is all or nothing.
Chaos is a name for any order that produces confusion in our minds.
Chaos is a condition of the mind, not of the world.
Fighting is pure chaos, and to be a good fighter you simply have to be prepared mentally and physically to handle that chaos.
The chaos can act as a magnifier of quantum fluctuations so that they can produce sizable effects in the world around us. But we know that that can happen often.
I'm trying to make order out of chaos, trying to find some way of rationalising the horrific things that people do or the way the world is.
Chaos in the midst of chaos isn't funny, but chaos in the midst of order is.
Chaos is the enemy of Order but the enemy of Chaos is also the enemy of Order.
Chaos is everywhere and artists, to fashion art and live truthfully, have no choice but to invite this unwanted guest right into the studio.
It's a lack of clarity that creates chaos and frustration. Those emotions are poison to any living goal.

Chaos does not mean total disorder. Chaos means a multiplicity of possibilities. Chaos is from the ancient Greek words that means a thing that is birthed from the void. And it was about that which is possible, not about disorder.
Chaos is rejecting all you have learned, chaos is being yourself.
Chaos is merely order waiting to be deciphered.
The chaos we see in nature are the limitations of our perceptions, when we view the world with the eyes of nature, all we shall see are perfection.
Chaos is the first condition. Order is the first law. Continuity is the first reflection. Quietude is the first happiness.
Freedom is just Chaos, with better lighting.
Chaos often breeds life, when order breeds habit.
Chaos furnishes the building blocks for order, and order breaks down to replenish chaos.
Chaos and Order are not enemies, only opposites. Chaos and Order combined equal balance.
The battlefield is a scene of constant chaos. The winner will be the one who controls that chaos, both his own and the enemies.
Chaos demands to be recognized and experienced before letting itself be converted into a new order.
A great deal of the chaos in the world occurs because people don't appreciate themselves.
Darkness is the only place, where chaos and peace always met and fell in love with each other.
Chaos is found in greatest abundance wherever order is being sought. It always defeats order, because it is better organized.
Chaos is roving through the system and able to undo, at any point, the best laid plans.
If the chaos is overwhelming, I start making lists. To write it down puts it in perspective.
Chaos should be regarded as extremely good news!
In Chaos Magic, beliefs are not seen as ends in themselves, but as tools for creating desired effects.
Chaos is nothing more than beauty about to dance.
Chaos and destruction do tend to take away a person's dating possibilities.
We live in a rainbow of chaos.
Chaos is the score upon which reality is written.
Chaos was the law of nature; Order was the dream of man.

Chaos is impatient. It's random. And above all it's selfish. It tears down everything just for the sake of change, feeding on itself in constant hunger. But Chaos can also be appealing. It tempts you to believe that nothing matters except what you want.
Chaos is perhaps at the bottom of everything.
You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star.
Chaos has come to be associated with the study of anything complex, but, in fact, the mathematical techniques are directly applicable only to simple systems that appear to be complex.
In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.
It's a cruel and random world, but the chaos is all so beautiful.
In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
One man's idea of perfect order is another man's chaos.
We negotiate with chaos for some sense of satisfaction.
Let chaos reign, then rein in chaos.
Introduce a little anarchy, upset the established order, and everything becomes chaos. I’m an agent of chaos, and you know the thing about chaos? It's fair.
The imagination is the power that enables us to perceive the normal in the abnormal, the opposite of chaos in chaos.
We adore chaos because we love to produce order.
Where no plan is laid, where the disposal of time is surrendered merely to the chance of incident, chaos will soon reign.
When the mind withdraws into itself and dispenses with facts it makes only chaos.

I believe that life is chaotic, a jumble of accidents, ambitions, misconceptions, bold intentions, lazy happenstances, and unintended consequences, yet I also believe that there are connections that illuminate our world, revealing its endless mystery and wonder.
Chaotic people often have chaotic lives, and I think they create that. But if you try and have an inner peace and a positive attitude, I think you attract that.
By building relations we create a source of love and personal pride and belonging that makes living in a chaotic world easier.
Every passion borders on the chaotic, but the collector's passion borders on the chaos of memories.
A schedule defends from chaos and whim. It is a net for catching days. It is a scaffolding on which a worker can stand and labor with both hands at sections of time.
Everybody's a mad scientist, and life is their lab. We're all trying to experiment to find a way to live, to solve problems, to fend off madness and chaos.
When the moon / Of your mind becomes / Clouded over with confusion, / You are searching / Around for the light outside.

Blue sky and fine weather can abruptly change to tremulous lightning and rolling thunder. Violent winds and angry rains can abruptly change to serene moonlight and a clear sky. Has the universe ever ceased its workings? Has the universe ever been impeded? Human nature is also like this.
Viewed from the summit of reason, all life looks like a malignant disease and the world like a madhouse.
There is nothing stable in the world—uproar's your only music.
There are some enterprises in which a careful disorderliness is the true method.
I have a great belief in the fact that whenever there is chaos, it creates wonderful thinking. I consider chaos a gift.
To have order, you must have randomness, because where you have no randomness order cannot manifest itself.
Contrary to what we tend to assume, the normal state of the mind is chaos.
In the chaos there is the burgeoning of creative quantum leaps of major phase transitions. Therefore, not only embrace the chaos but also embrace the uncertainty in the inherent chaos.
Confusion is the welcome mat at the door of creativity.
Life is nothing without a little chaos to make it interesting.
Chaos is a friend of mine. It's like I accept him; does he accept me?
Our real discoveries come from chaos, from going to the place that looks wrong and stupid and foolish.

I finally figured out that not every crisis can be managed... As much as we want to keep ourselves safe, we can't protect ourselves from everything. If we want to embrace life, we also have to embrace chaos.
Chaos contains information that can lead to knowledge—even wisdom.
Chaos and disorder is like a pebble in my shoe or loose hair under my shirt collar.
Disorder is the condition of the mind's fertility; it contains the mind's promise, since its fertility depends upon the unexpected, it depends rather on what we do not know... than what we know.
All genius is a conquering of chaos and mystery.
